question:
A company wants to migrate two DNS servers to AWS. The servers host a total of approximately 200 zones and receive 1 million requests each day on average. The company wants to maximize availability while minimizing the operational overhead that is related to the management of the two servers.

What should a solutions architect recommend to meet these requirements?

options.A: Create 200 new hosted zones in the Amazon Route 53 console. Import zone files.
options.B: Launch a single large Amazon EC2 instance. Import zone files. Configure Amazon CloudWatch alarms and notifications to alert the company about any downtime.
options.C: Migrate the servers to AWS by using AWS Server Migration Service (AWS SMS). Configure Amazon CloudWatch alarms and notifications to alert the company about any downtime.
options.D: Launch an Amazon EC2 instance in an Auto Scaling group across two Availability Zones. Import zone files. Set the desired capacity to 1 and the maximum capacity to 3 for the Auto Scaling group. Configure scaling alarms to scale based on CPU utilization.

explanation: Amazon Route 53 is a highly available, managed DNS service that eliminates operational overhead of managing DNS servers. It can easily handle 200 zones and millions of queries with built-in redundancy across multiple locations globally.
